info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 31 at 12:59PM EDT until March 31 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Central Mecklenburg County. * WHEN...Until 400 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1255 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to showers and thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Flooding is most likely in Freedom Park along Little Sugar Creek, where walkways and the East Boulevard parking areas will be affected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Uptown Charlotte, Central Charlotte, South Charlotte, East Charlotte, Northeast Charlotte, The Plaza, Freedom Park, Southpark Mall and Hidden Valley. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed.
